TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebRequestModuleElement extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: Represents a URI prefix and the associated class that handles creating Web requests for the prefix. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Using the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> classes, applications can request resources for any valid <xref:System.Uri>. Use this configuration element to specify a module that is registered to work with the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.Create%2A> overloads to create new requests.
This class corresponds to the [\<add\> Element for webRequestModules (Network Settings)](../Topic/%3Cadd%3E%20Element%20for%20webRequestModules%20\(Network%20Settings\).md) configuration element.
This class is used to specify modules registered to authenticate requests made with the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebClient> classes.
This class provides programmatic access to information that can be stored in configuration files.
The .NET Framework version 2.0 provides Web request modules that create requests for resources with the following prefixes:
- HTTP
- HTTPS
- FTP
- FILE

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string prefix, string type) cil managed

Docs.param: A string containing a URI prefix.
A string containing the type and assembly information for the class that handles creating requests for resources that use the `prefix` URI prefix. For more information, see the Remarks section.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified URI prefix and type information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `type` parameter contains the fully qualified type name followed by a comma (,) and the assembly information. The elements of the assembly information are separated with commas, for example, "`System.Net.DigestClient, System, Version=2.0.3600.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089"`.
The <xref:System.Net.Configuration.WebRequestModuleElement.Prefix%2A> property is set to `prefix` and the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.WebRequestModuleElement.Type%2A> property is set to `type`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string prefix, class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: A string containing a URI prefix.
A <xref:System.Type> that identifies the class that handles creating requests for resources that use the `prefix` URI prefix.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified URI prefix and type identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.Configuration.WebRequestModuleElement.Prefix%2A> property is set to `prefix` and the <xref:System.Net.Configuration.WebRequestModuleElement.Type%2A> property is set to `type`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URI prefix for the current Web request module.
Docs.value: A string that contains a URI prefix.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The .NET Framework version 2.0 provides Web request modules that create requests for resources with the following prefixes:
- HTTP
- HTTPS
- FTP
- FILE

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a class that creates Web requests.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Type> instance that identifies a Web request module.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Using the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> classes, applications can request resources for any valid <xref:System.Uri>. Use this property to specify a type that is registered to work with the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.Create%2A> method to create new requests.
The .NET Framework version 2.0 provides Web request modules that create requests for resources with the following prefixes:
- HTTP
- HTTPS
- FTP
- FILE
